Got an order in for a big stack of high-quality wood and stone, for building defenses and the like. From what I hear from the front, they're going to need plenty of it soon enough. Can you get out there and collect some for me?
The resources you're pulling in today might be saving someone's life tomorrow.

Seems that the Sixth got hit by an awful rainstorm holding their hill the other night, and that much mud and rain plays hell with bows and leathers. Need to get new gear made up, so you gotta pull me in some hide and wood quick-like, alright?
Don't normally want to be fielding archers in those sorts of conditions, but war ain't always normal.

Rumour is the last attack didn't have enough magical support, and it cost our troops pretty heavily. I'm anticipating a rush order for Mages' gear soon, and I'd like to get ahead of the curve on this one. Can you pull in the resources I need?
If they'd had a few more healers out there, they might've lost a lot fewer troops...
You're a veteran at this by now, right? So I say "more tools needed", and you're already up and off collecting the wood and ore we need. Right? The circle... yes...
You know the drill - I don't need to give you any more instructions.

Just got word, the last big attack was a failure. Lotta dead people, and a lotta busted-up armour and weapons. They need ore, hide and fiber for replacement equipment ASAP, or they're going to be fighting off the counter-attack with sticks and stones.
Luckily the field smiths are pretty good at patching up plate by now. King knows they've had plenty of practice...
Big shipment of medical supplies for the front. We need to make sure our medics are seriously stocked up before we start the next push, because they're going to need it.
Let's just hope our casualties come back in few enough pieces that they need healers rather than gravediggers.

You be careful with these - very careful. The compounds in these barrels are very unstable. If there's a spark anywhere near you as you're carrying them, you and your fine mount will spontaneously combust. Yes, that means fire. No, it's not good.
Please keep a safe distance from... well, anyone and everyone.

This is a load of old scrap metal we've found digging around the ruins in the centre of the continent. Should be bashed into makeshift shields and helms for the poorer troops if they can't craft one themselves.
We're hoping we haven't picked up any of that antique gold our historians were looking at...

You're a trusted ally at this point, so I'll be straight with you: here is a package of assassination orders, please take them to my colleague so he can distribute them to our agents. If we can eliminate certain enemy leaders, it'll save a lot of lives.
Yes, there are a lot of them. I know.
Casualty reports from our front-line patrols, for delivery. It's important for the King and his advisors to have a good idea of what's happening, and keeping track of troop losses is part of that.
Yes, there are a lot of them. I know.

Identification rings for regimental leaders. Sometimes when the big white guys with the maces get hold of one... there's no other way of us knowing who they were so we can tell their family. Make sure these get delivered and worn, yes?
Being able to tell their families is the least we owe them.
A dark thing lurks in the shadows; silent footsteps, a heavy cloak, eyes alight with madness and the glimmer of gold. Destroy it, that we might make more offerings to Mother.
Mother gives so much, and asks so little. We must give her the offerings.
The Arsonists work indiscriminately, setting light to the dry grasses and burning entire forests to the ground. We cannot bear it, it burns us too! Please help us protect the wild from their flames!
Break their bodies as they break our hearts!
Heretic mages disrupt the flows of the land. Dispose of them and their kin.
My brethren suffer from stab-wounds and stolen fetishes. Find those responsible and break them.
We tire of the Heretics' poor arrows. They do dishonour to the wood that made them! Break their quivers, and their necks too.
What shame, to be killed by such poor craftsmanship!
The priestesses of Morgana are channels for her power, tainting the earth with her touch once more. They tether her to this world - the tie must be broken!
She is diminished, but never dead. We must remove anything that could light her path back to this world!
The Disciples of Morgana return to Albion. Their helms burn bright with cunning. End them, now.
There can be no mercy here, friend.
They take life from the land, but nothing more. They dishonour the spirits of those they kill. Repay the debt.
To kill the creatures of the land is permitted, provided you bring them new purpose.
The cultists spread Her lies. Reach them and silence them; She is capable of corrupting even the strongest minds.
The weak must not hear Her words!
You have served Albion well, friend. Take this token to [variable:AGENT_A], that you may serve further.
Service does the land honour, friend.

An Infiltrator entered our yearly ritual of the equinox, and picked off the weak as they danced and made music... The children, the old, the sick praying to be healed... This is an abomination. Kill any you see. And make them suffer.
The archmages, reawakened, still seek to push the boundaries of magic. We grow wary of their foul experiments. Ensure they are... made safe.
They play with powers beyond their control. They cannot be allowed to continue.

These are the Voyagers, the bold adventures sent out against the forces of Morgana at the height of the war. None of them ever returned. Their will to follow their masters, for victory in battle, still remains. They were so young... Put their hearts to rest.
They have done more than their duty.
Why do they walk the land once more? We can hope that destroying their physical form will allow them to rest again.
It is a sad duty, but a necessary one.
They loose their arrows with the same courage, the same strength... but now no purpose. Give them peace.
They do not understand this new world.
What secrets might their mages carry with them? But we owe them their peace, they have suffered enough.
One death is more than enough for any soul.
This sneak thief sends in his underlings to goad our steel away, then takes what he wishes from our abandoned camps. The Heretics are far too puny to bear our weapons; what do they want with them?
We fear they may be melting down our weapons to arm their legions...
The Heretics use fire to thin our ranks. Our Cultists burn and our knights roast alive inside their armor. I want the fire mages to know true pain as we do.
Children should not be allowed to play with fire...
It's so much easier to create fear when you remove the safety nets, don't you think? Go out and kill some Heretic healers, that should make our other efforts much more effective.
Destroying ones enemies from the bottom up is... rather beautiful, don't you think?
The slight ones roam in the shadows; they know no honour in combat! Make sure they are facing you when you deal the final blow.
But to see the light leave their eyes...
The crazed ones like to fight from afar, with magic and arrows.Our cultists can only remove so many - bring the rats in close for once.
Their flesh is soft, their bones brittle.
The heavy ones are made to drink the milk of some flower before they go into battle, and it drives away any fear or pain, allowing them to kill many before they are brought down.
The Disciples need no poisons; She gives us bravery and courage for battle.

A Giant's boulder struck one of our bravest champions days ago. Shattered her spine inside her armor, nothing we could do. I had to remove her helmet and slit her throat myself. I want you to promise me that I won't have to do that again.
If you do this... The Disciples will be in your debt, truly. And that means something.
The old ones are savage and ruthless. They grow crazed in battle, defending their precious land. Show them the refined manner of the Knight.
It's a chilling sight, no? Hoards of frothing, painted faces rushing into battle? Take heart, dear.
Where we employ brawn and steel to battle, the Keepers use stone straight from the earth. Show them the inferiority of their weapons.
The Druids have mastered the magical energies of Albion, but we have never yielded to them before, and will not start now.
The old ones are savage and ruthless. They grow crazed in battle, defending their precious land. Show them the refined manner of the Knight.
It's a chilling sight, no? Hoards of frothing, painted faces rushing into battle? Take heart, dear.
Where we employ brawn and steel to battle, the Keepers use stone straight from the earth. Show them the inferiority of their weapons.
The Druids have mastered the magical energies of Albion, but we have never yielded to them before, and will not start now.
You please the lady Morgana. Take this letter to [variable:AGENT_A] in the wastes, and take the fight to the heart of their foul crypts
The chief archers have some ancient poison on their arrows. With all their strength and steel, how can our knights fight that which attacks their very blood?
We fear that whatever plant or berry bore the antidote died out many years ago - as the undead should have!
Only the Undead could wield the magic of doom so masterfully. It's said the bells in their ruined churches and crypts still hum with that obscene power. Silence them!
When their magic is quelled, perhaps the ringing will stop?
The Voyagers interfered the most with Morgana's plans; an endless sea of trained soldiers, still brought to their knees by a mere whisper from Her lips. And now they dare to meddle again?
Perhaps being buried once is not enough...
Why do these soldiers of old appear animate now? Be a sweet and return them to their prior state, would you? What happened in the old wars should stay buried...
What happened in the old wars should stay buried...
The Undead work with some magical power now, and they wield it like experienced sorcerers. How far they have come since the wars...
Cut down the mages - they pose the biggest threat.
One would think the dead had learned the first time... No matter, some lessons demand a second teaching.
Maybe this time they will learn? One can but hope...

The thieves desecrate our crypts, stealing tokens and preparations from the tombs of our brothers and sisters. Now their souls will never make the journey they set out to on death, and will suffer for all eternity. Stop the thieves!
They do not know the damage they do!
The ones with the knives... always poking, always digging. What for? They bring us to the surface, and they break us when they find us. Punish them
They show no clear purpose, they just destroy.
The hermits... Their magic burns us, eats us away inside where we have no inside. Drive them away from us.
How can it hurt so much? What is it they wield?
These... "Heretics". They destroy, they subvert, they create nothing of worth, all they bring is decay and dissolution... They should be excised, for the good of all.
The living... squander their existence. Why?
The Berserks hammer us to pieces! Fragments scattered to the winds, a disgraceful burial! We are husks, yes, but may we not at least remain whole?
Destroy those who bring us disgrace!
The giants! Their every step sends a shiver down through the earth! They crack the stones of our crypts and trap us in the dark. To be buried is a fate to suffer only once!
They won't be easy to bring down... They never have been.
The men here... always running, stamping, shouting... it shakes our bones, it jars our joints... does it wake us from our sleep? We wish to sleep... Stop them. Please.
Why must they break the earth with their stride?
The ones with the long beards... our mages sense their magic, say they work with powers of life. Is it them who bind us to this undeath? We wish to sleep... Make them stop.
If they do not understand, they should not meddle!
Drumming and dancing and running and chanting and stamping and stomping and crashing and thumping... Too much too much TOO MUCH MAKE THEM STOP... We only wish to sleep...
What corruption compels them to agitate the land so?
The men here... always running, stamping, shouting... it shakes our bones, it jars our joints... does it wake us from our sleep? We wish to sleep... Stop them. Please.
Why must they break the earth with their stride?
The ones with the long beards... our mages sense their magic, say they work with powers of life. Is it them who bind us to this undeath? We wish to sleep... Make them stop.
If they do not understand, they should not meddle!
Drumming and dancing and running and chanting and stamping and stomping and crashing and thumping... Too much too much TOO MUCH MAKE THEM STOP... We only wish to sleep...
What corruption compels them to agitate the land so?

They call them Priestesses... But there was nothing so unholy and dishonourable! It was they who buried our brothers and sisters in unmarked graves; trapped their souls beyond retrieval. I want them to feel that fear.
See how they feel to be denied a final audience with their abhorrent Queen!
The ones in robes... they stand behind and keep control. Mayhap they know something of our prior fate?
Did you find what was inside them?
We... remember a hail of bolts, falling out of the sky. Ours? Or theirs? Collect some for us, perhaps they will stir memory.
The hum of the string, it calls to us... a warning?
We watch them fight, and something stirs. Were... were we soldiers? Is this a shard of memory? Or did we merely watch?
It is so hard to be sure, the past is like a broken mirror. Are we broken?
You bring us the rest we crave... We thank you... [variable:AGENT_A] also seeks your help - will you go to their aid?
You bring quiet... This is good...
The Icons are made in Her image, abhorrent reminders of what once was. They are Her most powerful magic-wielders, and their very existence threatens Albion. Remove this threat!
Be careful, the Icons wield powerful dark magic.
These armored knights... we know that strange glow behind that metal. Why do they return now?
The armour - we must know all you can tell of their armour!
The cultists move to some hidden purpose, some silent beating drum... and a tang in the deepest earths... brimstone? This bodes evil.
To what foul purpose do they bend their will?
At every turn, blades and bolts block our search. Clear the way, so that our wisest might hope to understand...
It pains us to beg assistance in this, but their strength!
You have served Albion well, friend. Take this token to [variable:AGENT_A], that you may serve further.
Service does the land honour, friend.
It brings us little pleasure, but the Undead must be stopped before the damage they do threatens our lands. Do what must be done.
Be gentle if you can, but you must return them to their rest.
Why do those who fought and died wish to fight again? And why do those who stood with the land now struggle against it?
There is a higher power at work here.
The cycle of life and death is central to this land... but these Undead subvert its workings. They are an aberration that must be corrected.
Close the circle, for their own good as well as for ours.
The Undead reign in the Deadlands, plaguing the skies with their foul mists; our champions cannot fight cloaked enemies. Perhaps you can?
As much as we love the dark, this world cannot be left to fester in their mists.
We need to make our way into the crypts of the Undead far below the earth. Never you mind why. We need the space... clean.
We need a large, clear space for our work.
The armies, risen again, are as strong as ever. But they were overpowered once; and must be again.
We know those horns, the brutal, glowing heart of that staff, the cruelty in those eyes. A High Priestess, sent to do Her bidding. She must not be allowed to continue!
Don't get too close! And remember: You must never listen to a word she utters!
The Knights... we remember their blades... We remember them scything us down like wheat... So much power... More than a man should ever contain. Kill them as they killed us.
We do not feel pity... Because they do not deserve it, or because we no longer can?

Their Soldiers... We gave as good as we got. It was a fair fight, us against them... But then they brought... OTHER things to bear. The Soldiers gloated as they ran us through, once the balance was tipped in their favour. Show them how it feels.
They had our respect... At first...
Their bolts fell into us, like a piercing arch. Our arrows flew in return, but without the dark weight that rained down on our heads. They were... unnatural.
They pierced through us, and they pierced through the stones around us.
They seek to recover their former strength, but they have not attained it yet. We must strike now, before they do. Go, help [variable:AGENT_A] make the final push!
This time, we will have our revenge.
Demons. The Cultists consort with demons. Kill them. All. NOW!
We fear for the very land itself, if their plans come to pass...
Do the Disciples have a new puppeteer now? Or are they caught in a pact? No matter - they must be held to account.
They will be held accountable for their experiments with dark forces, as they were before.
They are all equally culpable in the atrocity they strive towards. End them as the monsters they are.
How could any living person countenance such an offence against life itself?
The Cultists, they brought the darkness before. We will not allow them to do so again. Find them. Kill them. Break the cycle.
They know what they do, and they will not repent. They must be brought to justice.
Their infantry, they fight on the side of darkness. We must stand in the light, and let them know they cannot succeed a second time. Strike them down.
We remember. We do not hate. But we finally understand. We know what must be done.

Last we fought, they broke us 'cross their knee. Now they find that without their dark power they are weak, and yet without our flesh we still stand strong. Let them taste the bitter realization that we last knew when we saw the battle's looming end.
This is no longer our time, but this is finally our turn.
This is MY castle. Get out!
You’ve ruined your own lands, you’ll not ruin mine!
Even more little souls... your lifeforce calls to me....
All this lifeforce around me.... I SHALL BECOME DEATH
I will kill you... with fire… hehe!
Your existence threatens the balance... you must die...
Come to me! I'll give your flesh to the birds of the sky and to the beasts of the field
You thought this would be easy?
We are not done anytime soon!
You got this far... but you will go no further!
What? So many of you? No matter.
Your numbers are meaningless, I will fight even harder!
Arrrr! Fighting so many of you awakens the power of Morgana in me!
I've got a bolt with your name on it...
You will make a lovely sacrifice...
The more you bring, the more will die...
Numbers cannot bring me down, you are only making me angrier...
Numbers cannot bring me down, I am at my peak
The Dark Lady orders you to die!
You have tested my patience for too long - prepare to meet your doom.

When defending this territory, all defenders get a buff if your defense bonus is positive, or a debuff if it is negative. Launching attacks from this territory will lower the Defense Bonus. Remaining peaceful will increase the Defense Bonus of this territory over time.

Every time you fail to defend your territory against a 'conquer' attack you lose a Defender Point. If you lose the last point, the attacker will take over this territory. Defender Points regenerate over time.

Estates are plots of land you can acquire to construct various buildings. You can share or trade them with other players.
Grundstücke kann man kaufen um darauf verschiede Gebäude zu errichten. Man kann sie mit anderen Spielern teilen oder handeln.

Es gibt verschiedene eingeborene Fraktionen in Albion, jede mit ihren eigenen Stärken und Schwächen.

In diesem Gebiet können nur Gebäude bis zu dieser Stufen gebaut oder ausgebaut werden.

There are four different security levels: Safe, Yellow, Red, and Black. In Safe, you cannot attack other players and others cannot loot your corpse for a certain period after death. In Yellow, attacking other players is permitted, but peaceful players receive advantages. In Red, players may attack each other freely without any penalties. In Black, everyone is assumed to be hostile at all times.

Es gibt verschiedene Sicherheitsstufen: Sicher, Beschränktes Pvp und Volles Pvp. In sicheren Gebieten kann man keine anderen Spieler angreifen und die eigene Leiche kann für eine bestimmte Zeit nicht geplündert werden. In Beschränktem Pvp darf man andere Spieler angreifen, friedliche Spieler erhalten aber Vorteile. In Vollen Pvp-Gebieten darf jeder jeden angreifen ohne Nachteile fürchten zu müssen.
A higher presence of a resource type makes it more likely to find higher tier resources of that type. Note also the highest tier of any resource present in this area.
